Evidence Type.description: Brief description on the type of paleoseismic evidence

Contact Name.description: A uniquely indentified name for each interpreted paleoseismic event. Contact names are based largely on those published in primary literature.

Site.description: The geographic name for each site based largely on those published in primary literature.

Latitude [\u00b0].description: A general latitude for the site in decimal degrees.

Longitude [\u00b0].description: A general longitude for the site in decimal degrees.

Environment.description: The type of environment that the paleoseismic evidence is preserved in.

Length of Record [cal yr BP].description: The maximum known age of the record.

Site-Averaged Evidence Rank\n(0 - 3).description: An average value for the quality of evidence for paleoseismic events at each site.

Evidence for coseismic proxy.description: A description of the published paleoseismic evidence within the stratigraphy or the environment.

Age quality ranking 5 - Annual-subannual.description: A yes/no entry for whether the age control includes material capable of providing annual to sub-annual precision.  If this is marked yes, the age control quality is scored at 5.

Age quality ranking 4.5 - \"Close-limiti.description: A yes/no entry for whether the age control includes material defined as a "close-limiting" age. If this is marked yes, the age control quality is scored at 4.5.

Age quality ranking 4 - Age with growth-.description: A yes/no entry for whether the age control includes plant material that is in growth position (i.e. not detrital). If this is marked yes, the age control quality is scored at 4.

Age quality ranking 3.5 - Multiple brack.description: A yes/no entry for whether the age control includes material collected above and below the event and therefore provides a maximum and minimum age and also includes tephra material. If this is marked yes, the age control quality is scored at 3.5.

Age quality ranking 3 - Multiple bracket.description: A yes/no entry for whether the age control includes material collected above and below the event and therefore provides a maximum and minimum age. If this is marked yes, the age control quality is scored at 3.

Age quality ranking 2.5 - Non-bracketing.description: A yes/no entry for whether the age control includes more than one radiocarbon age, but only material collected above or below the event, and also includes tephra material. If this is marked yes, the age control quality is scored at 2.5.

Age quality ranking 2 - Non-bracketing a.description: A yes/no entry for whether the age control includes more than one radiocarbon age, but only material collected above or below the event. If this is marked yes, the age control quality is scored at 2.

Age quality ranking 1.5 - Single detrita.description: A yes/no entry for whether the age control includes a single detrital radiocarbon age analysis and also includes tephra material. If this is marked yes, the age control quality is scored at 1.5.

Age quality ranking 1 - Single detrital.description: A yes/no entry for whether the age control includes a single detrital radiocarbon age analysis. If this is marked yes, the age control quality is scored at 1.

Age quality ranking 0.5 - Modeled age fr.description: A yes/no entry for whether the age control is derived from a modeled estimate but not from dating material directly above or below the event or if the material dated is from benthic foraminifera. If this is marked yes, the age control quality is scored at 0.5.

Age Rank\n(0 - 5).description: A numerical score on the quality of age control, between 0 and 5, based on the material dated.

Certainty of earthquake evidence A - Dis.description: A yes/no entry for whether there is stratigraphic evidence for a disruptive feature that is laterally exntensive. If marked yes, this provides 1 point towards the Evidence Rank.

Certainty of earthquake evidence B - Cha.description: A yes/no entry for whether the feature is specifically characteristic of seismic triggering. If marked yes, this provides 1 point towards the Evidence Rank.

Certainty of earthquake evidence C - Sit.description: A yes/no entry for whether the site susceptibility omits triggering by non-seismic sources. If marked yes, this provides 1 point towards the Evidence Rank.

Certainty of earthquake evidence Evidenc.description: A numerical score on the quality of paleoseismic evidence, between 0 and 3.

Sum of ranking criteria.description: A sum of the Age and Evidence Rank for each event.

No. of pulses.description: The number of pulses apparent in the geophysical logs.

Grain size.description: Grain size information about the feature.

Susceptibility to triggering.description: A general estimate of how susceptibly a feature or landscape is to seismic triggering.

Intesity of shaking [g].description: The estimated intensity of shaking required to create a shaking proxy at this site. This value may come from the direct reference or from estimated shaking magnitudes for other simlar features worldwide.

Duration of shaking.description: The estimated duration of shaking required to create a shaking proxy at this site. This value may come from the direct reference or from estimated shaking duration for other simlar features worldwide.

Erosive base.description: A yes/no entry for whether the feature has an erosive base.

Provenance.description: A yes/no entry for whether there is provenance information available for the feature.

Radiocarbon age mean [yr BP].description: Reported mean uncalibrated radiocarbon age from the literature in radiocarbon years before present (1950 CE).

Radiocarbon age uncertainty [yr BP].description: Reported uncertainty in uncalibrated radiocarbon age from the literature in radiocarbon years before present (1950 CE).

Published Event Age Minimum [cal yr BP].description: Published minimum calibrated age for candidate paleoseismic evidence in calendar years before present (1950 CE).

Published Event Age Maximum [cal yr BP].description: Published maximum calibrated age for candidate paleoseismic evidence in calendar years before present (1950 CE).

Age comments.description: Compiler comments on age information published in primary literature.

Inferred most likely evidence source.description: The published most likely source for an event.

Other possible evidence source interpret.description: The published alternative sources for an event.

Reference.description: Literature reference for the compiled information.

Notes.description: Notes from compilers that may be specifically useful for interpreting the paleoseismic evidence compiled for this specific site or event.
